005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.AllianceStationID;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.ControlWord;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.MatchInfoData;
011import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTable;
012import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableEntry;
013import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
014import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
015import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
016import java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition;
017import java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock;
018import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
019
020/** Provide access to the network communication data to / from the Driver Station. */
021public class DriverStation {
022  /** Number of Joystick Ports. */
023  public static final int kJoystickPorts = 6;
024
025  private static class HALJoystickButtons {
026    public int m_buttons;
027    public byte m_count;
028  }
029
030  private static class HALJoystickAxes {
031    public float[] m_axes;
032    public short m_count;
033
034    HALJoystickAxes(int count) {
035      m_axes = new float[count];
036    }
037  }
038
039  private static class HALJoystickPOVs {
040    public short[] m_povs;
041    public short m_count;
042
043    HALJoystickPOVs(int count) {
044      m_povs = new short[count];
045      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
046        m_povs[i] = -1;
047      }
048    }
049  }
050
051  /** The robot alliance that the robot is a part of. */
052  public enum Alliance {
053    Red,
054    Blue,
055    Invalid
056  }
057
058  public enum MatchType {
059    None,
060    Practice,
061    Qualification,
062    Elimination
063  }
064
065  private static final double JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL = 1.0;
066  private static double m_nextMessageTime;
067
068  private static class DriverStationTask implements Runnable {
069    DriverStationTask() {}
070
071    @Override
072    public void run() {
073      DriverStation.run();
074    }
075  } /* DriverStationTask */
076
077  private static class MatchDataSender {
078    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
079    NetworkTable table;
080
081    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
082    NetworkTableEntry typeMetadata;
083
084    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
085    NetworkTableEntry gameSpecificMessage;
086
087    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
088    NetworkTableEntry eventName;
089
090    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
091    NetworkTableEntry matchNumber;
092
093    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
094    NetworkTableEntry replayNumber;
095
096    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
097    NetworkTableEntry matchType;
098
099    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
100    NetworkTableEntry alliance;
101
102    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
103    NetworkTableEntry station;
104
105    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
106    NetworkTableEntry controlWord;
107
108    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
109    boolean oldIsRedAlliance = true;
110
111    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
112    int oldStationNumber = 1;
113
114    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
115    String oldEventName = "";
116
117    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
118    String oldGameSpecificMessage = "";
119
120    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
121    int oldMatchNumber;
122
123    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
124    int oldReplayNumber;
125
126    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
127    int oldMatchType;
128
129    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
130    int oldControlWord;
131
132    MatchDataSender() {
133      table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("FMSInfo");
134      typeMetadata = table.getEntry(".type");
135      typeMetadata.forceSetString("FMSInfo");
136      gameSpecificMessage = table.getEntry("GameSpecificMessage");
137      gameSpecificMessage.forceSetString("");
138      eventName = table.getEntry("EventName");
139      eventName.forceSetString("");
140      matchNumber = table.getEntry("MatchNumber");
141      matchNumber.forceSetDouble(0);
142      replayNumber = table.getEntry("ReplayNumber");
143      replayNumber.forceSetDouble(0);
144      matchType = table.getEntry("MatchType");
145      matchType.forceSetDouble(0);
146      alliance = table.getEntry("IsRedAlliance");
147      alliance.forceSetBoolean(true);
148      station = table.getEntry("StationNumber");
149      station.forceSetDouble(1);
150      controlWord = table.getEntry("FMSControlData");
151      controlWord.forceSetDouble(0);
152    }
153
154    private void sendMatchData() {
155      AllianceStationID allianceID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
156      boolean isRedAlliance = false;
157      int stationNumber = 1;
158      switch (allianceID) {
159        case Blue1:
160          isRedAlliance = false;
161          stationNumber = 1;
162          break;
163        case Blue2:
164          isRedAlliance = false;
165          stationNumber = 2;
166          break;
167        case Blue3:
168          isRedAlliance = false;
169          stationNumber = 3;
170          break;
171        case Red1:
172          isRedAlliance = true;
173          stationNumber = 1;
174          break;
175        case Red2:
176          isRedAlliance = true;
177          stationNumber = 2;
178          break;
179        default:
180          isRedAlliance = true;
181          stationNumber = 3;
182          break;
183      }
184
185      String currentEventName;
186      String currentGameSpecificMessage;
187      int currentMatchNumber;
188      int currentReplayNumber;
189      int currentMatchType;
190      int currentControlWord;
191      m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
192      try {
193        currentEventName = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.eventName;
194        currentGameSpecificMessage = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
195        currentMatchNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
196        currentReplayNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
197        currentMatchType = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchType;
198      } finally {
199        m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
200      }
201      currentControlWord = HAL.nativeGetControlWord();
202
203      if (oldIsRedAlliance != isRedAlliance) {
204        alliance.setBoolean(isRedAlliance);
205        oldIsRedAlliance = isRedAlliance;
206      }
207      if (oldStationNumber != stationNumber) {
208        station.setDouble(stationNumber);
209        oldStationNumber = stationNumber;
210      }
211      if (!oldEventName.equals(currentEventName)) {
212        eventName.setString(currentEventName);
213        oldEventName = currentEventName;
214      }
215      if (!oldGameSpecificMessage.equals(currentGameSpecificMessage)) {
216        gameSpecificMessage.setString(currentGameSpecificMessage);
217        oldGameSpecificMessage = currentGameSpecificMessage;
218      }
219      if (currentMatchNumber != oldMatchNumber) {
220        matchNumber.setDouble(currentMatchNumber);
221        oldMatchNumber = currentMatchNumber;
222      }
223      if (currentReplayNumber != oldReplayNumber) {
224        replayNumber.setDouble(currentReplayNumber);
225        oldReplayNumber = currentReplayNumber;
226      }
227      if (currentMatchType != oldMatchType) {
228        matchType.setDouble(currentMatchType);
229        oldMatchType = currentMatchType;
230      }
231      if (currentControlWord != oldControlWord) {
232        controlWord.setDouble(currentControlWord);
233        oldControlWord = currentControlWord;
234      }
235    }
236  }
237
238  private static DriverStation instance = new DriverStation();
239
240  // Joystick User Data
241  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxes = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
242  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVs = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
243  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtons = new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
244  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfo = new MatchInfoData();
245
246  // Joystick Cached Data
247  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxesCache = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
248  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVsCache = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
249  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtonsCache =
250      new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
251  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfoCache = new MatchInfoData();
252
253  // Joystick button rising/falling edge flags
254  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsPressed = new int[kJoystickPorts];
255  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsReleased = new int[kJoystickPorts];
256
257  // preallocated byte buffer for button count
258  private static final ByteBuffer m_buttonCountBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(1);
259
260  private static final MatchDataSender m_matchDataSender;
261
262  // Internal Driver Station thread
263  private static Thread m_thread;
264
265  private static volatile boolean m_threadKeepAlive = true;
266
267  private static final ReentrantLock m_cacheDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
268
269  private static final Lock m_waitForDataMutex;
270  private static final Condition m_waitForDataCond;
271  private static int m_waitForDataCount;
272  private static final ThreadLocal<Integer> m_lastCount = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> 0);
273
274  private static boolean m_silenceJoystickWarning;
275
276  // Robot state status variables
277  private static boolean m_userInDisabled;
278  private static boolean m_userInAutonomous;
279  private static boolean m_userInTeleop;
280  private static boolean m_userInTest;
281
282  // Control word variables
283  private static final ReentrantLock m_controlWordMutex = new ReentrantLock();
284  private static final ControlWord m_controlWordCache;
285  private static long m_lastControlWordUpdate;
286
287  /**
288   * Gets an instance of the DriverStation.
289   *
290   * @return The DriverStation.
291   * @deprecated Use the static methods
292   */
293  @Deprecated
294  public static DriverStation getInstance() {
295    return DriverStation.instance;
296  }
297
298  /**
299   * DriverStation constructor.
300   *
301   * <p>The single DriverStation instance is created statically with the instance static member
302   * variable.
303   */
304  private DriverStation() {}
305
306  static {
307    HAL.initialize(500, 0);
308    m_waitForDataCount = 0;
309    m_waitForDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
310    m_waitForDataCond = m_waitForDataMutex.newCondition();
311
312    for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
313      m_joystickButtons[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
314      m_joystickAxes[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
315      m_joystickPOVs[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
316
317      m_joystickButtonsCache[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
318      m_joystickAxesCache[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
319      m_joystickPOVsCache[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
320    }
321
322    m_controlWordCache = new ControlWord();
323    m_lastControlWordUpdate = 0;
324
325    m_matchDataSender = new MatchDataSender();
326
327    m_thread = new Thread(new DriverStationTask(), "FRCDriverStation");
328    m_thread.setPriority((Thread.NORM_PRIORITY + Thread.MAX_PRIORITY) / 2);
329
330    m_thread.start();
331  }
332
333  /** Kill the thread. */
334  public static synchronized void release() {
335    m_threadKeepAlive = false;
336    if (m_thread != null) {
337      try {
338        m_thread.join();
339      } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
340        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
341      }
342      m_thread = null;
343    }
344  }
345
346  /**
347   * Report error to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to error message.
348   *
349   * @param error The error to report.
350   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to error string
351   */
352  public static void reportError(String error, boolean printTrace) {
353    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, printTrace);
354  }
355
356  /**
357   * Report error to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to error message.
358   *
359   * @param error The error to report.
360   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
361   */
362  public static void reportError(String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
363    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, stackTrace);
364  }
365
366  /**
367   * Report warning to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to warning message.
368   *
369   * @param warning The warning to report.
370   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to warning string
371   */
372  public static void reportWarning(String warning, boolean printTrace) {
373    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, printTrace);
374  }
375
376  /**
377   * Report warning to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to warning message.
378   *
379   * @param warning The warning to report.
380   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
381   */
382  public static void reportWarning(String warning, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
383    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, stackTrace);
384  }
385
386  private static void reportErrorImpl(boolean isError, int code, String error, boolean printTrace) {
387    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, printTrace, Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace(), 3);
388  }
389
390  private static void reportErrorImpl(
391      boolean isError, int code, String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
392    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, true, stackTrace, 0);
393  }
394
395  private static void reportErrorImpl(
396      boolean isError,
397      int code,
398      String error,
399      boolean printTrace,
400      StackTraceElement[] stackTrace,
401      int stackTraceFirst) {
402    String locString;
403    if (stackTrace.length >= stackTraceFirst + 1) {
404      locString = stackTrace[stackTraceFirst].toString();
405    } else {
406      locString = "";
407    }
408    StringBuilder traceString = new StringBuilder();
409    if (printTrace) {
410      boolean haveLoc = false;
411      for (int i = stackTraceFirst; i < stackTrace.length; i++) {
412        String loc = stackTrace[i].toString();
413        traceString.append("\tat ").append(loc).append('\n');
414        // get first user function
415        if (!haveLoc && !loc.startsWith("edu.wpi.first")) {
416          locString = loc;
417          haveLoc = true;
418        }
419      }
420    }
421    HAL.sendError(isError, code, false, error, locString, traceString.toString(), true);
422  }
423
424  /**
425   * The state of one joystick button. Button indexes begin at 1.
426   *
427   * @param stick The joystick to read.
428   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
429   * @return The state of the joystick button.
430   */
431  public static boolean getStickButton(final int stick, final int button) {
432    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
433      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-3");
434    }
435    if (button <= 0) {
436      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
437      return false;
438    }
439
440    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
441    try {
442      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
443        return (m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0;
444      }
445    } finally {
446      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
447    }
448
449    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
450        "Joystick Button "
451            + button
452            + " on port "
453            + stick
454            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
455    return false;
456  }
457
458  /**
459   * Whether one joystick button was pressed since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
460   *
461   * @param stick The joystick to read.
462   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
463   * @return Whether the joystick button was pressed since the last check.
464   */
465  public static boolean getStickButtonPressed(final int stick, final int button) {
466    if (button <= 0) {
467      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
468      return false;
469    }
470    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
471      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-3");
472    }
473
474    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
475    try {
476      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
477        // If button was pressed, clear flag and return true
478        if ((m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
479          m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
480          return true;
481        } else {
482          return false;
483        }
484      }
485    } finally {
486      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
487    }
488
489    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
490        "Joystick Button "
491            + button
492            + " on port "
493            + stick
494            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
495    return false;
496  }
497
498  /**
499   * Whether one joystick button was released since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
500   *
501   * @param stick The joystick to read.
502   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
503   * @return Whether the joystick button was released since the last check.
504   */
505  public static boolean getStickButtonReleased(final int stick, final int button) {
506    if (button <= 0) {
507      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
508      return false;
509    }
510    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
511      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-3");
512    }
513
514    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
515    try {
516      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
517        // If button was released, clear flag and return true
518        if ((m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
519          m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
520          return true;
521        } else {
522          return false;
523        }
524      }
525    } finally {
526      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
527    }
528
529    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
530        "Joystick Button "
531            + button
532            + " on port "
533            + stick
534            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
535    return false;
536  }
537
538  /**
539   * Get the value of the axis on a joystick. This depends on the mapping of the joystick connected
540   * to the specified port.
541   *
542   * @param stick The joystick to read.
543   * @param axis The analog axis value to read from the joystick.
544   * @return The value of the axis on the joystick.
545   */
546  public static double getStickAxis(int stick, int axis) {
547    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
548      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
549    }
550    if (axis < 0 || axis >= HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes) {
551      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick axis is out of range");
552    }
553
554    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
555    try {
556      if (axis < m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count) {
557        return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_axes[axis];
558      }
559    } finally {
560      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
561    }
562
563    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
564        "Joystick axis "
565            + axis
566            + " on port "
567            + stick
568            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
569    return 0.0;
570  }
571
572  /**
573   * Get the state of a POV on the joystick.
574   *
575   * @param stick The joystick to read.
576   * @param pov The POV to read.
577   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
578   */
579  public static int getStickPOV(int stick, int pov) {
580    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
581      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
582    }
583    if (pov < 0 || pov >= HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs) {
584      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick POV is out of range");
585    }
586
587    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
588    try {
589      if (pov < m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count) {
590        return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_povs[pov];
591      }
592    } finally {
593      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
594    }
595
596    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
597        "Joystick POV "
598            + pov
599            + " on port "
600            + stick
601            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
602    return -1;
603  }
604
605  /**
606   * The state of the buttons on the joystick.
607   *
608   * @param stick The joystick to read.
609   * @return The state of the buttons on the joystick.
610   */
611  public static int getStickButtons(final int stick) {
612    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
613      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-3");
614    }
615
616    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
617    try {
618      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons;
619    } finally {
620      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
621    }
622  }
623
624  /**
625   * Returns the number of axes on a given joystick port.
626   *
627   * @param stick The joystick port number
628   * @return The number of axes on the indicated joystick
629   */
630  public static int getStickAxisCount(int stick) {
631    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
632      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
633    }
634
635    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
636    try {
637      return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count;
638    } finally {
639      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
640    }
641  }
642

647   * @return The number of POVs on the indicated joystick
648   */
649  public static int getStickPOVCount(int stick) {
650    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
651      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
652    }
653
654    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
655    try {
656      return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count;
657    } finally {
658      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
659    }
660  }

662  /**
663   * Gets the number of buttons on a joystick.
664   *
665   * @param stick The joystick port number
666   * @return The number of buttons on the indicated joystick
667   */
668  public static int getStickButtonCount(int stick) {
669    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
670      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
671    }
672
673    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
674    try {
675      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count;
676    } finally {
677      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
678    }
679  }
680
681  /**
682   * Gets the value of isXbox on a joystick.
683   *
684   * @param stick The joystick port number
685   * @return A boolean that returns the value of isXbox
686   */
687  public static boolean getJoystickIsXbox(int stick) {
688    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
689      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
690    }
691
692    return HAL.getJoystickIsXbox((byte) stick) == 1;
693  }
694
695  /**
696   * Gets the value of type on a joystick.
697   *
698   * @param stick The joystick port number
699   * @return The value of type
700   */
701  public static int getJoystickType(int stick) {
702    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
703      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
704    }
705
706    return HAL.getJoystickType((byte) stick);
707  }
708
709  /**
710   * Gets the name of the joystick at a port.
711   *
712   * @param stick The joystick port number
713   * @return The value of name
714   */
715  public static String getJoystickName(int stick) {
716    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
717      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
718    }
719
720    return HAL.getJoystickName((byte) stick);
721  }
722
723  /**
724   * Returns the types of Axes on a given joystick port.
725   *
726   * @param stick The joystick port number
727   * @param axis The target axis
728   * @return What type of axis the axis is reporting to be
729   */
730  public static int getJoystickAxisType(int stick, int axis) {
731    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
732      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
733    }
734
735    return HAL.getJoystickAxisType((byte) stick, (byte) axis);
736  }
737
738  /**
739   * Returns if a joystick is connected to the Driver Station.
740   *
741   * <p>This makes a best effort guess by looking at the reported number of axis, buttons, and POVs
742   * attached.
743   *
744   * @param stick The joystick port number
745   * @return true if a joystick is connected
746   */
747  public static boolean isJoystickConnected(int stick) {
748    return getStickAxisCount(stick) > 0
749        || getStickButtonCount(stick) > 0
750        || getStickPOVCount(stick) > 0;
751  }
752
753  /**
754   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be enabled.
755   *
756   * @return True if the robot is enabled, false otherwise.
757   */
758  public static boolean isEnabled() {
759    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
760    try {
761      updateControlWord(false);
762      return m_controlWordCache.getEnabled() && m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
763    } finally {
764      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
765    }
766  }
767
768  /**
769   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be disabled.
770   *
771   * @return True if the robot should be disabled, false otherwise.
772   */
773  public static boolean isDisabled() {
774    return !isEnabled();
775  }
776
777  /**
778   * Gets a value indicating whether the Robot is e-stopped.
779   *
780   * @return True if the robot is e-stopped, false otherwise.
781   */
782  public static boolean isEStopped() {
783    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
784    try {
785      updateControlWord(false);
786      return m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
787    } finally {
788      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
789    }
790  }
791
792  /**
793   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
794   * autonomous mode.
795   *
796   * @return True if autonomous mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
797   */
798  public static boolean isAutonomous() {
799    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
800    try {
801      updateControlWord(false);
802      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
803    } finally {
804      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
805    }
806  }
807
808  /**
809   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
810   * autonomous mode and enabled.
811   *
812   * @return True if autonomous should be set and the robot should be enabled.
813   */
814  public static boolean isAutonomousEnabled() {
815    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
816    try {
817      updateControlWord(false);
818      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous() && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
819    } finally {
820      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
821    }
822  }
823
824  /**
825   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
826   * operator-controlled mode.
827   *
828   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
829   * @deprecated Use isTeleop() instead.
830   */
831  @Deprecated(since = "2022", forRemoval = true)
832  public static boolean isOperatorControl() {
833    return isTeleop();
834  }
835
836  /**
837   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
838   * operator-controlled mode.
839   *
840   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
841   */
842  public static boolean isTeleop() {
843    return !(isAutonomous() || isTest());
844  }
845
846  /**
847   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
848   * operator-controller mode and enabled.
849   *
850   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
851   * @deprecated Use isTeleopEnabled() instead.
852   */
853  @Deprecated(since = "2022", forRemoval = true)
854  public static boolean isOperatorControlEnabled() {
855    return isTeleopEnabled();
856  }
857
858  /**
859   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
860   * operator-controller mode and enabled.
861   *
862   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
863   */
864  public static boolean isTeleopEnabled() {
865    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
866    try {
867      updateControlWord(false);
868      return !m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous()
869          && !m_controlWordCache.getTest()
870          && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
871    } finally {
872      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
873    }
874  }
875
876  /**
877   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in test
878   * mode.
879   *
880   * @return True if test mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
881   */
882  public static boolean isTest() {
883    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
884    try {
885      updateControlWord(false);
886      return m_controlWordCache.getTest();
887    } finally {
888      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
889    }
890  }
891
892  /**
893   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station is attached.
894   *
895   * @return True if Driver Station is attached, false otherwise.
896   */
897  public static boolean isDSAttached() {
898    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
899    try {
900      updateControlWord(false);
901      return m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
902    } finally {
903      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
904    }
905  }
906
907  /**
908   * Gets if a new control packet from the driver station arrived since the last time this function
909   * was called.
910   *
911   * @return True if the control data has been updated since the last call.
912   */
913  public static boolean isNewControlData() {
914    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
915    try {
916      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
917      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
918        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
919        return true;
920      }
921    } finally {
922      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
923    }
924    return false;
925  }
926
927  /**
928   * Gets if the driver station attached to a Field Management System.
929   *
930   * @return true if the robot is competing on a field being controlled by a Field Management System
931   */
932  public static boolean isFMSAttached() {
933    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
934    try {
935      updateControlWord(false);
936      return m_controlWordCache.getFMSAttached();
937    } finally {
938      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
939    }
940  }

943   * Get the game specific message.
944   *
945   * @return the game specific message
946   */

948    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
949    try {
950      return m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
951    } finally {
952      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
953    }
954  }

957   * Get the event name.
958   *
959   * @return the event name
960   */
961  public static String getEventName() {
962    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
963    try {
964      return m_matchInfo.eventName;
965    } finally {
966      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
967    }
968  }
969
970  /**
971   * Get the match type.
972   *
973   * @return the match type
974   */
975  public static MatchType getMatchType() {
976    int matchType;
977    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
978    try {
979      matchType = m_matchInfo.matchType;
980    } finally {
981      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
982    }
983    switch (matchType) {
984      case 1:
985        return MatchType.Practice;
986      case 2:
987        return MatchType.Qualification;
988      case 3:
989        return MatchType.Elimination;
990      default:
991        return MatchType.None;
992    }
993  }
994

996   * Get the match number.
997   *
998   * @return the match number
999   */
1000  public static int getMatchNumber() {
1001    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1002    try {
1003      return m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
1004    } finally {
1005      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1006    }
1007  }

1010   * Get the replay number.
1011   *
1012   * @return the replay number
1013   */
1014  public static int getReplayNumber() {
1015    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1016    try {
1017      return m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
1018    } finally {
1019      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1020    }
1021  }
1022
1023  /**
1024   * Get the current alliance from the FMS.
1025   *
1026   * @return the current alliance
1027   */
1028  public static Alliance getAlliance() {
1029    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1030    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1031      return Alliance.Invalid;
1032    }
1033
1034    switch (allianceStationID) {
1035      case Red1:
1036      case Red2:
1037      case Red3:
1038        return Alliance.Red;
1039
1040      case Blue1:
1041      case Blue2:
1042      case Blue3:
1043        return Alliance.Blue;
1044
1045      default:
1046        return Alliance.Invalid;
1047    }
1048  }
1049
1050  /**
1051   * Gets the location of the team's driver station controls.
1052   *
1053   * @return the location of the team's driver station controls: 1, 2, or 3
1054   */
1055  public static int getLocation() {
1056    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1057    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1058      return 0;
1059    }
1060    switch (allianceStationID) {
1061      case Red1:
1062      case Blue1:
1063        return 1;
1064
1065      case Red2:
1066      case Blue2:
1067        return 2;
1068
1069      case Blue3:
1070      case Red3:
1071        return 3;
1072
1073      default:
1074        return 0;
1075    }
1076  }
1077
1078  /**
1079   * Wait for new data from the driver station.
1080   *
1081   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1082   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1083   */
1084  public static void waitForData() {
1085    waitForData(0);
1086  }
1087
1088  /**
1089   * Wait for new data or for timeout, which ever comes first. If timeout is 0, wait for new data
1090   * only.
1091   *
1092   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1093   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1094   *
1095   * @param timeoutSeconds The maximum time in seconds to wait.
1096   * @return true if there is new data, otherwise false
1097   */
1098  public static boolean waitForData(double timeoutSeconds) {
1099    long startTimeMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1100    long timeoutMicroS = (long) (timeoutSeconds * 1e6);
1101    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1102    try {
1103      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
1104      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
1105        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
1106        return true;
1107      }
1108      while (m_waitForDataCount == currentCount) {
1109        if (timeoutMicroS > 0) {
1110          long nowMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1111          if (nowMicroS < startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS) {
1112            // We still have time to wait
1113            boolean signaled =
1114                m_waitForDataCond.await(
1115                    startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS - nowMicroS, TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS);
1116            if (!signaled) {
1117              // Return false if a timeout happened
1118              return false;
1119            }
1120          } else {
1121            // Time has elapsed.
1122            return false;
1123          }
1124        } else {
1125          m_waitForDataCond.await();
1126        }
1127      }
1128      m_lastCount.set(m_waitForDataCount);
1129      // Return true if we have received a proper signal
1130      return true;
1131    } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1132      // return false on a thread interrupt
1133      Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1134      return false;
1135    } finally {
1136      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1137    }
1138  }
1139
1140  /**
1141   * Return the approximate match time. The FMS does not send an official match time to the robots,
1142   * but does send an approximate match time. The value will count down the time remaining in the
1143   * current period (auto or teleop). Warning: This is not an official time (so it cannot be used to
1144   * dispute ref calls or guarantee that a function will trigger before the match ends) The Practice
1145   * Match function of the DS approximates the behavior seen on the field.
1146   *
1147   * @return Time remaining in current match period (auto or teleop) in seconds
1148   */
1149  public static double getMatchTime() {
1150    return HAL.getMatchTime();
1151  }
1152
1153  /**
1154   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1155   * purposes only.
1156   *
1157   * @param entering If true, starting disabled code; if false, leaving disabled code
1158   */
1159  public static void inDisabled(boolean entering) {
1160    m_userInDisabled = entering;
1161  }
1162
1163  /**
1164   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1165   * purposes only.
1166   *
1167   * @param entering If true, starting autonomous code; if false, leaving autonomous code
1168   */
1169  public static void inAutonomous(boolean entering) {
1170    m_userInAutonomous = entering;
1171  }
1172
1173  /**
1174   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1175   * purposes only.
1176   *
1177   * @param entering If true, starting teleop code; if false, leaving teleop code
1178   * @deprecated Use {@link #inTeleop(boolean)} instead.
1179   */
1180  @Deprecated(since = "2022", forRemoval = true)
1181  public static void inOperatorControl(boolean entering) {
1182    m_userInTeleop = entering;
1183  }
1184
1185  /**
1186   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1187   * purposes only.
1188   *
1189   * @param entering If true, starting teleop code; if false, leaving teleop code
1190   */
1191  public static void inTeleop(boolean entering) {
1192    m_userInTeleop = entering;
1193  }

1195  /**
1196   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1197   * purposes only.
1198   *
1199   * @param entering If true, starting test code; if false, leaving test code
1200   */
1201  public static void inTest(boolean entering) {
1202    m_userInTest = entering;
1203  }
1204
1205  /** Forces waitForData() to return immediately. */
1206  public static void wakeupWaitForData() {
1207    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1208    try {
1209      m_waitForDataCount++;
1210      m_waitForDataCond.signalAll();
1211    } finally {
1212      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1213    }
1214  }
1215
1216  /**
1217   * Allows the user to specify whether they want joystick connection warnings to be printed to the
1218   * console. This setting is ignored when the FMS is connected -- warnings will always be on in
1219   * that scenario.
1220   *
1221   * @param silence Whether warning messages should be silenced.
1222   */
1223  public static void silenceJoystickConnectionWarning(boolean silence) {
1224    m_silenceJoystickWarning = silence;
1225  }
1226
1227  /**
1228   * Returns whether joystick connection warnings are silenced. This will always return false when
1229   * connected to the FMS.
1230   *
1231   * @return Whether joystick connection warnings are silenced.
1232   */
1233  public static boolean isJoystickConnectionWarningSilenced() {
1234    return !isFMSAttached() && m_silenceJoystickWarning;
1235  }
1236
1237  /**
1238   * Copy data from the DS task for the user. If no new data exists, it will just be returned,
1239   * otherwise the data will be copied from the DS polling loop.
1240   */
1241  protected static void getData() {
1242    // Get the status of all of the joysticks
1243    for (byte stick = 0; stick < kJoystickPorts; stick++) {
1244      m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_count =
1245          HAL.getJoystickAxes(stick, m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_axes);
1246      m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_count =
1247          HAL.getJoystickPOVs(stick, m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_povs);
1248      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_buttons = HAL.getJoystickButtons(stick, m_buttonCountBuffer);
1249      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_count = m_buttonCountBuffer.get(0);
1250    }
1251
1252    HAL.getMatchInfo(m_matchInfoCache);
1253
1254    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1255    try {
1256      // Force a control word update, to make sure the data is the newest.
1257      updateControlWord(true);
1258    } finally {
1259      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1260    }
1261
1262    // lock joystick mutex to swap cache data
1263    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1264    try {
1265      for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
1266        // If buttons weren't pressed and are now, set flags in m_buttonsPressed
1267        m_joystickButtonsPressed[i] |=
1268            ~m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1269
1270        // If buttons were pressed and aren't now, set flags in m_buttonsReleased
1271        m_joystickButtonsReleased[i] |=
1272            m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & ~m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1273      }
1274
1275      // move cache to actual data
1276      HALJoystickAxes[] currentAxes = m_joystickAxes;
1277      m_joystickAxes = m_joystickAxesCache;
1278      m_joystickAxesCache = currentAxes;
1279
1280      HALJoystickButtons[] currentButtons = m_joystickButtons;
1281      m_joystickButtons = m_joystickButtonsCache;
1282      m_joystickButtonsCache = currentButtons;
1283
1284      HALJoystickPOVs[] currentPOVs = m_joystickPOVs;
1285      m_joystickPOVs = m_joystickPOVsCache;
1286      m_joystickPOVsCache = currentPOVs;
1287
1288      MatchInfoData currentInfo = m_matchInfo;
1289      m_matchInfo = m_matchInfoCache;
1290      m_matchInfoCache = currentInfo;
1291    } finally {
1292      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1293    }
1294
1295    wakeupWaitForData();
1296    m_matchDataSender.sendMatchData();
1297  }
1298
1299  /**
1300   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1301   * the DS.
1302   */
1303  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedError(String message) {
1304    double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1305    if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1306      reportError(message, false);
1307      m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1308    }
1309  }
1310
1311  /**
1312   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1313   * the DS.
1314   */
1315  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(String message) {
1316    if (isFMSAttached() || !m_silenceJoystickWarning) {
1317      double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1318      if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1319        reportWarning(message, false);
1320        m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1321      }
1322    }
1323  }
1324
1325  /** Provides the service routine for the DS polling m_thread. */
1326  private static void run() {
1327    int safetyCounter = 0;
1328    while (m_threadKeepAlive) {
1329      HAL.waitForDSData();
1330      getData();
1331
1332      if (isDisabled()) {
1333        safetyCounter = 0;
1334      }
1335
1336      safetyCounter++;
1337      if (safetyCounter >= 4) {
1338        MotorSafety.checkMotors();
1339        safetyCounter = 0;
1340      }
1341      if (m_userInDisabled) {
1342        HAL.observeUserProgramDisabled();
1343      }
1344      if (m_userInAutonomous) {
1345        HAL.observeUserProgramAutonomous();
1346      }
1347      if (m_userInTeleop) {
1348        HAL.observeUserProgramTeleop();
1349      }
1350      if (m_userInTest) {
1351        HAL.observeUserProgramTest();
1352      }
1353    }
1354  }
1355
1356  /**
1357   * Forces a control word cache update, and update the passed in control word.
1358   *
1359   * @param word Word to update.
1360   */
1361  public static void updateControlWordFromCache(ControlWord word) {
1362    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1363    try {
1364      updateControlWord(true);
1365      word.update(m_controlWordCache);
1366    } finally {
1367      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1368    }
1369  }
1370
1371  /**
1372   * Updates the data in the control word cache. Updates if the force parameter is set, or if 50ms
1373   * have passed since the last update.
1374   *
1375   * <p>Must be called with m_controlWordMutex lock held.
1376   *
1377   * @param force True to force an update to the cache, otherwise update if 50ms have passed.
1378   */
1379  private static void updateControlWord(boolean force) {
1380    long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1381    if (now - m_lastControlWordUpdate > 50 || force) {
1382      HAL.getControlWord(m_controlWordCache);
1383      m_lastControlWordUpdate = now;
1384    }
1385  }
1386}
